result.execSummary:
The defendant Steven Joseph Bottcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

timeConds.notes: imposed and stayed, to be imposed upon the discretion of the agent and upon order of the court on count 1 only.

records.addlTxt: Plea date on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference on April 11, 2022 at 03:45 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Steven Joseph Bottcher appeared by video, Attorney Nathan J. Heim appeared by video for Steven Joseph Bottcher. 
Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
Offer deadline 03-25-2022
Scheduling conference is set for 04-11-2022 at 3:45pm
Further proceedings scheduled for March 25, 2022 at 08:29 am.

Defendant demands a preliminary hearing.   Preliminary hearing is set for 02-23-22 at 2:30 p.m.    
Minutes.
RE:  Felony bail jumping as repeater, on 01-19-22.

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of felony possess THC, possess drug paraphernalia, felony bail jumping and misdemeanor bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 02-14-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $5,000.00 recognizance bond with the condition that he have no contact with Meijers Store located at 1818 S. Rapids Road, Manitowoc, WI.  Bail furnished and defendant is released from custody. Court orders photos and prints at MTPD.
Minutes.
